item.title: Working with semi-unstructred text in R
item.description: Motivation Toying with an classification problem, that uses the uses the Federalist Papers, I became more interested in converting unstructured text into a format for analysis than the actual model. The goal was to train the classifier on known author and use that model to predict the author of the dozen or so essays where authorship is unknown (or at least debatable). I didn‚Äôt have the original data set. Let‚Äôs see how trivial it is to create the document.

item.title: Home Field Advantage in the NFL
item.description: Calculating HFA for NFL the Easy Way We are going to come up with a number for home field advantage (pretend we don‚Äôt already know that 3 points is a pretty solid estimate). Since we only need team, score, and location we could use just about any dataset. For NFL data it‚Äôs hard to beat ArmchairAnalysis for quality and price. The GAME.csv file contains all the information we‚Äôre looking for (which isn‚Äôt much more than team scores).

item.title: Bad Bet: Do sports handicappers win? Part 1
item.description: Most of this was written a while back, I wouldn‚Äôt code some of the simulations the same way now, but everything still works so it‚Äôs being left as is. The packages needed for examples below. library(gridExtra) library(tidyverse) theme_set(theme_minimal()) Selling Flap-Doddle Handicappers that sell their picks to the general public don‚Äôt win and are a bad bet for gamblers. note: the only long term documented exception to this rule I know of is RAS but as they say ‚Äúone point does not a trend make.

item.title: Bad Bet: Do sports handicappers win? Part 2
item.description: So far we‚Äôve been using a flat betting model where our bettors bet size never varies. While this might be easier to model it isn‚Äôt very realistic. We could go with something like the Kelly criterion to determine the bet size but we‚Äôll opt for easy again and use ‚Äúx‚Äù percentage of the bettor‚Äôs bankroll. This means instead of using an infinite bankroll where a player can never run out of money we will start with a fixed sum.
